qualitative_description: The candidate TMB model implements an NPZ structure with all three state variables and includes nutrient uptake, phytoplankton growth, grazing, mortality, recycling, and zooplankton growth. However, many mechanistic details differ from the TRUTH model: uptake/growth are formulated as a nutrient Monod × explicit light limitation combined via a harmonic-mean co-limitation (theta) rather than the TRUTH product (N/(e+N))*(a/(b+c*P)). Grazing is a standard Holling type II in the candidate instead of the P^2/(mu^2+P^2) form in TRUTH. The candidate adds several ecological/physical processes not in the TRUTH model (explicit light self-shading and mixed-layer averaging, Q10 temperature scaling, a phytoplankton assimilation efficiency parameter, and separate phytoplankton recycling fraction). The candidate also omits the TRUTH environmental mixing/entrainment term in the nutrient equation and the explicit mixing loss for phytoplankton. Overall: core roles are present, some components match TRUTH exactly (linear mortalities, absence/presence of Z-mixing), many are valid alternates (Michaelis-Menten uptake, Holling-II grazing), and several extra ecological processes are added.

nutrient_equation_uptake.matched_form: Michaelis-Menten nutrient uptake combined with saturating light limitation (harmonic co-limitation)
nutrient_equation_uptake.explanation: Candidate: dN_dt includes -epsilon_P_bounded * uptake where uptake = r_P_temp * growth_limitation * P_prev and nutrient_limitation = N_prev/(K_N + N_prev) and light_limitation = I_avg/(K_I + I_avg). Code: "Type nutrient_limitation = N_prev / (K_N + N_prev + eps);" and "Type uptake = r_P_temp * growth_limitation * P_prev;". TRUTH uses (N/(e+N))*(a/(b+c*P))*P; candidate uses Monod in N and explicit light term (alternate family).

nutrient_equation_recycling.matched_form: Recycling from mortality (fractional remineralization of P_loss and Z_loss)
nutrient_equation_recycling.explanation: Candidate: recycling = gamma_P_bounded * P_loss + gamma_Z_bounded * Z_loss with P_loss = m_P_temp * P_prev and Z_loss = m_Z_temp * Z_prev. Code: "Type recycling = gamma_P_bounded * P_loss + gamma_Z_bounded * Z_loss;". TRUTH recycles via different specific terms (r*P, beta*lambda_*P^2/(mu^2+P^2)*Z, gamma*q*Z). Candidate recycles mortalities only (different form).

nutrient_equation_mixing.explanation: TRUTH: includes mixing k*(N0 - N). Candidate: no mixing/entrainment term present in dN_dt. Candidate dN_dt = -epsilon_P_bounded * uptake + recycling (no (N0-N) term). Code: "Type dN_dt = -epsilon_P_bounded * uptake + recycling;"

phytoplankton_equation_growth.matched_form: Resource-limited growth = r_P_temp * combined(N- and I-limitation) * P (Monod × saturating light with harmonic co-limitation)
phytoplankton_equation_growth.explanation: Candidate: uptake = r_P_temp * growth_limitation * P_prev where growth_limitation is computed from nutrient_limitation = N_prev/(K_N+N_prev) and light_limitation = I_avg/(K_I+I_avg) with harmonic mean (theta). Code: "Type uptake = r_P_temp * growth_limitation * P_prev;" and harmonic formulation lines. TRUTH uses (N/(e+N))*(a/(b+c*P))*P — different but a standard alternate (Monod+explicit light).

phytoplankton_equation_grazing_loss.matched_form: Holling Type II grazing (g_max * P/(K_Z + P) * Z)
phytoplankton_equation_grazing_loss.explanation: Candidate: "Type grazing = g_max_temp * (P_prev / (K_Z + P_prev + eps)) * Z_prev;". TRUTH uses lambda_ * P^2/(mu^2 + P^2) * Z (a different saturating P-dependence). Candidate matches an alternate (Holling-II) listed in the catalogue.

phytoplankton_equation_mortality.explanation: Candidate: P_loss = m_P_temp * P_prev then dP_dt subtracts P_loss: "Type P_loss = m_P_temp * P_prev;" and "Type dP_dt = epsilon_P_bounded * uptake - grazing - P_loss;". TRUTH uses linear -r*P (and an s*P term), so both are linear mortality forms (equivalent role).

phytoplankton_equation_mixing.explanation: TRUTH: includes physical loss via -(s + k)*P (k is mixing). Candidate: no explicit mixing/entrainment term in dP_dt (only mortality and grazing). Code: "Type dP_dt = epsilon_P_bounded * uptake - grazing - P_loss;"

zooplankton_equation_growth.matched_form: Growth = assimilation efficiency * grazing (epsilon_Z * grazing) with Holling-II grazing
zooplankton_equation_growth.explanation: Candidate: "Type dZ_dt = epsilon_Z_bounded * grazing - Z_loss;" with grazing defined as Holling II. TRUTH: alpha * lambda_ * P^2/(mu^2+P^2) * Z (different functional form). Candidate implements the alternate "assimilation efficiency × grazing" family.

zooplankton_equation_mortality.explanation: Candidate: Z_loss = m_Z_temp * Z_prev and dZ_dt subtracts Z_loss: "Type Z_loss = m_Z_temp * Z_prev;" and "Type dZ_dt = epsilon_Z_bounded * grazing - Z_loss;". TRUTH uses linear -q*Z; both are linear mortality forms (structurally equivalent).

zooplankton_equation_mixing.explanation: TRUTH: dZ_dt = (growth) - q*Z (no mixing). Candidate likewise has no physical mixing term for Z. Candidate code: no k*(...) term appears in dZ_dt; "Type dZ_dt = epsilon_Z_bounded * grazing - Z_loss;"

extra_components_description: 1) Explicit light limitation & self-shading / MLD: computes I_avg from I_0, k_w, k_p, MLD and uses it in light_limitation. 2) Flexible harmonic co-limitation (theta): combines nutrient and light limitations via a tunable harmonic-mean formulation. 3) Temperature dependence (Q10): multiplicative Q10 scaling applied to biological rates. 4) Phytoplankton assimilation/uptake efficiency (epsilon_P_bounded): converts uptake into biomass (not present in TRUTH). 5) Explicit phytoplankton recycling fraction (gamma_P_bounded): recycling from P_loss to nutrients as a separate parameter.
